voicesplitting.voice.hmm

Class HmmVoiceSplitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.voice.hmm.HmmVoiceSplitter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VoiceSplitter

    public class HmmVoiceSplitter
extends java.lang.Object
implements VoiceSplitter
    This is the Voice Splitting algorithm submitted to ISMIR 2015. It involves a modified hmm algorithm.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 7 April, 2015

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • song

        private java.util.List<MidiNote> song
        A List of the MidiNotes that comprise a song. These should be in order of ascending onset time, which is the MidiNote's natural ordering.

      • voices

        private java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> voices
        A List of the Voices which we've split the song into. This is created by a call to getVoices(). Note that getVoices() will call generateVoices() upon its first run if it has not yet been called.

      • params

        private VoiceSplittingParameters params
        The parameters we are going to use for this run.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HmmVoiceSplitter

        public HmmVoiceSplitter(java.util.List<MidiNote> song,
                VoiceSplittingParameters params)
        Create a new HmmVoiceSplitter on the given song.
        Parameters:
        song - song
        params - The parameters we want to use for this Voice Split.

    • Method Detail

      • getF1

        public double getF1(java.util.List<java.util.List<MidiNote>> goldStandard)
        Get the F1 of this split.
        Parameters:
        goldStandard - The gold standard voices of this song.
        Returns:
        The F1 of this split.

      • getVoices

        public java.util.List<SingleNoteVoice> getVoices()
                                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Get the voices we've split the given song into. This will automatically call generateVoices() if it hasn't been yet. Otherwise, it simply returns voices.
        Specified by:
        getVoices in interface VoiceSplitter
        Returns:
        voices
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If we're running on a GUI and this gets cancelled.

      • generateVoices

        private void generateVoices()
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Generate the voices list. The first call to getVoices() will call this method automatically.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If we're running on a GUI and this gets cancelled.

      • handleIncoming

        private java.util.TreeSet<State> handleIncoming(java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                      java.util.TreeSet<State> states)
        Divide the notes in the given Set into voices.
        Parameters:
        incoming - A List of MidiNotes, all of which have the same onset time. Additionally, no note should have this onset time without being in this Set. This List will not be empty.
        states - A SortedSet of possible States at this step in the algorithm.
        Returns:
        A Set of the new states which we have transitioned into.
